message_1: A cryptographic hash function takes an input message and produces a fixed-length output known as a hash value. Suppose a cryptographic hash function produces a hash value which consists of 128 bits. How many different hash values can this function produce?
message_2:
A 128-bit hash function can produce 2^128 different hash values. This is because each bit can have 2 possible values (0 or 1), and there are 128 bits. So, the total number of different hash values is:

2^128 = 340,282,366,920,938,463,463,374,607,431,768,211,456
